image.altText: Two police under a marquee, surrounded by police tape, in a desert environment.

props.synopsis: A man has faced court charged with murder after his partner was found dead in Alice Springs in the early hours of Monday morning.

title.children: Man charged with murder after woman found dead by Alice Springs riverbed

image.altText: a drone shot of a mining camp in Central Australia.

props.synopsis: Arafura Rare Earths' Nolans Project will receive $200 million from a federal government fund, bringing total public investment to more than $1 billion.

title.children: New funding takes public investment in NT rare earths mine past $1b

image.altText: An aerial view shows a fishing boat moored near rocks

props.synopsis: Officials are investigating whether organised crime is behind a wave of illegal foreign fishing boats in Australian waters, which locals say are more sophisticated than ever before.

title.children: 'Unprecedented surge' in foreign boats entering Australian waters

image.altText: An aerial view of an exploration well in the Northern Territory's Beetaloo Basin on a patch of cleared land surrounded by bush

props.synopsis: The NT's environmental regulator is investigating the "inadvertent release" of highly salinated water near a fracking site in the Northern Territory's Beetaloo Basin. Environmental experts and advocates are warning the incident could be a sign of things to come.

title.children: Contaminated water pumped onto vegetation at Beetaloo Basin fracking site

image.altText: A man taking a selfie with his wife and son.

props.synopsis: A 63-year-old pilot who died in an ultralight plane crash near Darwin has been remembered as "a great father" with a love of adventure and learning.

title.children: 'Spark of adventure': Son's tribute for pilot killed in plane crash

image.altText: an array of different types of cooked barramundi on a table with sauces in white cups

props.synopsis: Battered barramundi eaten in Australia is unlikely to be Australian wild-caught, instead coming from farms in countries such as Thailand.

title.children: Lessons from foreign fish farms could put Aussie barramundi back on the table

image.altText: a large livestock vessel coming into port.

props.synopsis: Livestock shipping company Wellard strikes a deal to sell its only remaining income-producing asset and considers delisting from the stock exchange.

title.children: Wellard to sell only remaining ship and considers delisting from ASX

image.altText: A female in summer dress and ponytail stands next to daughter, 6 and son, 8, sitting at top of slide

props.synopsis: Families are facing crippling costs to educate their kids — even at public schools. It has led some to withdraw their children from hobbies and plan carefully simply to get them through school.

title.children: Parents turn to credit, grandparents in face of rising education costs

image.altText: Novak Djokovic holds his arms out and screams with rage during a match

props.synopsis: Round two gets underway at the Australian Open today and features an all star cast of Aryna Sabalenka, Novak Djokovic, Coco Gauff and Alexander Zverev. Follow live.

title.children: Djokovic fumes as he overcomes spirited qualifier, Aussies struggle on day four

image.altText: A coles shopping centre

props.synopsis: A major supermarket has announced it will no longer sell kitchen knives after one of its employees was allegedly stabbed by a 13-year-old boy in Queensland on Monday.

title.children: Coles to stop selling knives nationwide after staff member stabbed

image.altText: The Hollywood sign is seen as smoke haze covers the sky

props.synopsis: The 2028 Olympic Games feels like a world away, but one expert says the city of Los Angeles will still be rebuilding by the time the mega-event comes to town.

title.children: LA fires inch towards Olympic venues but 2028 Games 'not impossible'

image.altText: Bunch of people standing in well by the door on Sydney trains

props.synopsis: Angry commuters vent their frustration after facing delays with trains arriving late, running slowly or constantly stopping and starting at red signals.

title.children: 'It's ridiculous': Commuters vent at train delays on Sydney network

image.altText: One man smiles and another maintains a neutral expression as they look in front of where they stand

props.synopsis: Just days before his inauguration, US president-elect Donald Trump is yet to publicly state his position on the AUKUS pact, which would see Australia acquire nuclear-powered submarines from the US.

title.children: AUKUS pact keeping China's Xi Jinping up at night, Republican claims

image.altText: A man with mud on his face in the forrest.

props.synopsis: Foreign minister Penny Wong warns Russia that all diplomatic options "are on the table" as officials scramble to verify reports that Australian man Oscar Jenkins has been killed in Ukraine.

title.children: Wong warns Russia over reports captured Australian killed in Ukraine

image.altText: A man pushing his way through rubble of a building, which left has concrete and steel rebar in a heap.

props.synopsis: Talks have been underway in Doha for hours in a bid to reach agreement on the final elements of a deal between Israel and Hamas.

title.children: Gaza ceasefire talks and hostage deal at 'sensitive stage'

image.altText: A mother and daughter play at a table inside a home

props.synopsis: A four-year-old girl is recovering after being viciously mauled by a Rottweiler at a WA beach while on holiday with her family.

title.children: Family holiday spot now 'place of fear' after 4yo mauled by dog

image.altText: Elon Musk wears a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The US Securities and Exchange Commission is suing Elon Musk, the owner of social media site X, alleging the world's richest man held off declaring his substantial purchase of Twitter shares in 2022.

title.children: 'Totally broken organisation': Musk sued over Twitter share purchase

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A close up of a yellow circle with black outlines of two faces with black writing that says "Guzman y Gomez Mexican Kitchen".

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has lost earlier gains to close lower, ahead of key jobs data out tomorrow, along with US inflation numbers.

title.children: ASX closes down, upbeat outlook for Guzman y Gomez pushes shares higher — as it happened

image.altText: simon townsend

props.synopsis: Simon Townsend, best known for his role on the children's television show Wonder World, has died after recently being diagnosed with an aggressive cancer.

title.children: Wonder World host Simon Townsend dies aged 79

image.altText: Pete Hegseth shaking a fist walking out a door.

props.synopsis: Former Fox News host Pete Hegseth has come under fire for his inexperience, alleged drunkenness and past opposition to women in combat.

title.children: Trump nominee and former Fox host Pete Hegseth slammed for inexperience

image.altText: A damaged part of a bike.

props.synopsis: A rider who was thrown from his bike when it struck wire that was deliberately strung across a popular cycling path in Adelaide's south last week says it was only by luck that he "backed off the pace" moments before impact.

title.children: Cyclist who hit wire across Adelaide bike path condemns act of malice

image.altText: Sam in a black coat being followed by cameras and journalists.

props.synopsis: The Matildas star has been charged with causing a police officer harassment, alarm or distress under the UK's Public Order Act.

title.children: Sam Kerr faces London court on racially aggravated harassment charges

image.altText: A man in a festive black t-shirt smiles next to a grey-haired woman in a bright red dress.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Liberal government's leader in the upper house is facing accusations she has breached party rules by actively supporting her son — an independent candidate — to replace her.

title.children: Retiring Liberal promotes son to replace her instead of party's candidate

image.altText: Anti-Semitic graffiti mentioning Hitler and showing a swastika along a brick wall.

props.synopsis: The hand-picked representative for Jewish Australians, Jillian Segal, says a national cabinet meeting must be convened by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to respond to a spate of anti-Semitic attacks on home soil.

title.children: Anti-Semitism envoy urges national cabinet meeting after summer attacks

props.synopsis: In a move expected to be reversed by Donald Trump, US President Joe Biden is moving to lift the United States's designation of Cuba as a state sponsor of terrorism as part of a deal designed to free political prisoners on the island.

title.children: Biden moves to lift Cuba's designation as state sponsor of terrorism

image.altText: A picture of an illegaly made firearm

props.synopsis: Police have charged two people from north-east Victoria with more than 130 offences after finding homemade and stolen firearms at two properties.

title.children: Police target 'sophisticated' homemade guns during border town raids

image.altText: Two small giraffes walking away from each other.

props.synopsis: The giraffes, who are cousins, were born just four days apart at Mogo Wildlife Park. The pair now make up an 11-strong herd at Mogo and are already doing "zoomies" as they explore their new surroundings.

title.children: Two baby giraffes born just days apart in 'rare' conditions at NSW wildlife park

image.altText: A man celebrates a wicket during a Big Bash game

props.synopsis: Just over a month ago, Tom Andrews was working as a financial planner and thinking his cricket career was over. Now, he is forming part of Sydney Thunder's finals charge.

title.children: Tom Andrews journeys from office to Big Bash finals

image.altText: A plane dropping water over smoky yellow landscape, with fire trucks on the ground.

props.synopsis: Aerial support had to be halted during a fire fight in the state's south last week due to recreational drones — a problem firefighters say is becoming more common.

title.children: 'No room for error': Water bombers grounded again due to WA drone users

image.altText: A man and a child walk past a North Korean propaganda billboard in Pyongyang

props.synopsis: The Christian faith is considered treasonous and a "crime of all crimes" in North Korea, punishable by being sent to a gulag or execution, the Christian charity Open Doors says.

title.children: 'Kim is god' in North Korea, so being a Christian is potentially lethal

image.altText: A golden crucifix

props.synopsis: The union representing Australia's faith workers hopes the formal appointment of new bishops in Bunbury and Broome will help the Catholic church move on from a controversial period.

title.children: Hopes for fresh start as Vatican appoints new Bishops in Broome, Bunbury

image.altText: Finneas thumbnail Australia tour

props.synopsis: Finneas O'Connell, who has been touring Australia, says having to watch from afar as wildfires have torn his hometown of Los Angeles apart has been "staggering and shocking".

title.children: Grammy-winning musician Finneas says LA fires 'tragic and shocking'

image.altText: A young woman with dark hair and and a spotted blouse stands outdoors smiling.

props.synopsis: Skye Cusack threw herself into weight loss after doctors told her it would likely solve her mobility issues. But without the ability to exercise, she developed an eating disorder.

title.children: 'Who was I to disagree': Doctors blamed Skye's disability on her weight

image.altText: Adam Scott holds a large bunch of blue balloons in an office hallway in his role as Mark S in Severance.

props.synopsis: Three years since its premiere, Severance is finally returning to our screens. But there's a lot to remember ahead of season two — here's everything you need to know.

title.children: Severance came out 3 years ago. Here's what you need to know ahead of season 2
